properties.areaDesc: Heard, GA; Carroll, GA; Coweta, GA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:57PM EST until February 20 at 5:48PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg affecting Carroll...Coweta and
Heard Counties

Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Clayton...Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Crawford...
Talbot...Taylor and Upson Counties

Yellow River near East Lithonia affecting De Kalb and Rockdale
Counties

Yellow River near Conyers below Milstead affecting Newton and
Rockdale Counties

Middle Oconee River near Arcade affecting Barrow and Jackson
Counties

Oconee River near Penfield affecting Clarke...Greene and Oconee
Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg.
* From Wednesday evening until Thursday afternoon.
* At 11 PM Tuesday the stage was 10.7 feet and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 17 feet.
* Forecast to rise above flood stage by tomorrow evening and continue
to rise to near 17.8 feet by Thursday morning. The river is then
forecast to fall below flood stage by late Thursday morning.
* At 17 feet...Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the
woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from
the gage on U.S. Highway 27 or Georgia Highway 16. Flood waters
reach the top of the boat ramp at Riverside Park next to the
bridge. The playground at a day use area on the west side of the
Chattahoochee Bend State Park will begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
